page.title: 01THE KILTARLITY AREA
page.content: The Kiltarlity area is 16km south west of Inverness and comprises the scattered settlement of the parish of Kiltarlity.The land is hilly in the west of the block but fairly flat in the east.The village of Kiltarlity itself has approx 500 inhabitants although there are a further 400 people who live in the outlying areas. The roads serving the main population centre are good quality B type,but in the outlying areas most are single track with passing places.Amenities and services in the area include a sub-post office,a grocer's,a hotel, a primary school and a village hall. The area is mainly agricultural,with some forestry. Beaufort Castle,the residence of Simon Fraser{,Lord Lovat},is situated at the north east of the block,Lovat Estates being a major landowner in the area.
